data.title: wonderful plaza
data.text: a wonderful plaza with lots of activities all year round - organised concerts, street musicians, art, fairs, x-mas events, summer events & lots more. a wonderful place to be in down town with lots of shops, restaurants & bars around it. take your time & enjoy it.

data.title: The Center Of Town
data.text: It is a large treed park in the central square surrounded by various old buildings that you would expect in an old Spanish style town. There are Indian stalls under the veranda of the Palace of the Governors and a variety of stores, galleries  and restaurants to see. Also walk the side streets of the main square as they offer many interesting sights

data.title: Don't miss this quaint place
data.text: So glad we stopped by this plaza in Santa Fe. It's a beautiful, tranquil square with nice art galleries all around and street side vendors peddling their ware. You can skip the 2 street taco vendors tho, neither were that tasty. You must include Canyon Road on your itinerary, with amazing bronze art sculptures/ wind mobile galore.

data.title: "I have returned, but disappointed"
data.text:
I visited here twenty years ago.  
Sure, the plaza is still there as it has been for hundreds of years but in the last twenty it has gotten more expensive and the shop keepers are waiting for you with greedy hands.  All the tourist shops and restaurants have hidden the unique cultural flavor of the area.
You can't park for free, and parking for three hours was 5 bucks.  Everything seemed way overpriced, (a burger with fries for $12.95?)
There is jewelry, artworks, clothing and textiles galore that are very nice and but very expensive.
My wife and I thought the best part was just being in the center plaza, enjoying music, watching people just hang out.
Be sure to visit the plaza and bring a picnic lunch.  And if money is no concern for you, then this a wonderful place to shop and buy.

data.title: All Seasons All People
data.text: Just a marvelous place to see people and vendors- artists, jewelers, and people just wandering a round.  Some are playing guitars or accordions, some are having a picnic. Pigeons are struting around gobbling crumbs delicately.  We were successful in finding one of my favorite artists  Kiren Levy and we bought 8 of her works ( balloons and kitty cats)   Make sure you plan to walk the entire perimeter- there is a lot to see.  Take a lunch with you and enjoy the day- it just does not get any better than this for relaxing during a trip

data.title: The epicenter of action for all tourists
data.text: This is where there is an authentic Indian market - under the eves of the Palace of the Governors. There are food vendors (really good food, too). Almost every night in the summer season there is a free concert in the plaza bandstand. Often there are events where antique cars are on display all around the Plaza. Bottom line, this is where you begin your exploration of Santa Fe.

data.title: Great Place to Visit
data.text: Historic Santa Fe Plaza is a must to visit for historical sites, dining, shopping and relaxation.  The cathedral is a focal point for a start to our visits.  Shopping and dinning venues are plentiful, ranging from quaint shops, sidewalk vendors, food kiosks and brick and mortar restaurants.

data.title: Lovely square
data.text: The heart of Santa Fe.  This is a lovely little square, great to sit in, people watch and just watch the world go by.

data.title: So much to do, so much to see!
data.text: Great art displays, the locals sell things from clothing, food, art, pottery, jewelry...you name it, they probably have it. We went during Fiesta weekend so there was a lot to do, food and music everywhere. We had a great time here!

data.title: Cool spot to stop
data.text: This is a place we have visited time and again.  The shops here are mostly over priced but there are a few off the main track that you can find good deals at. Also the local Indians selling their wares near the museum are encouraged by the the government to maintain traditional crafts and have good deals and authentic wares.

data.title: Santa Fe Plaza
data.text: I'm very disappointed with the change here. Although I could afford items in the  shops I would not pay the stupid high mark up prices. I don't think the Plaza is the Old Santa Fe the tourist are coming to see. I'm gratefull that I was here when Woolworth was the main store and the plaza was a place for the locals to come for picnics.

data.title: No trip to Santa Fe is complete without Plaza
data.text: Whether we are staying close or not, we always have to go the plaza at least once each trip.  It is always great to see the native artists with their beautiful jewelry, pottery etc. in front of Palace of the Governors.  There is usually live music.  We are not too interested in shopping, especially tourist traps but there are many nice galleries/museums close by.

data.title: Bellísima por todos lados!!!
data.text: Para todos los amantes de la fotografía, está plaza es lo mejor. Destaca su arquitectura y sus bellos arboles. Un lugar encantador y bello.

data.title: Adobe Bau in Perfektion!
data.text: Ein Gang über die Plaza und durch den grünen Park ist Pflichtprogramm in Santa Fe. Nette Restaurants auf Dachterassen, Cafés, Shops, ein grüner Park eingerahmt an allen Seiten mit Adobe Bauten. Im Park bieten Einheimische Fast Food an. Nicht weit vom Zentrum entfernt einer meiner Favoriten in SF ein Parkhaus im Adobe Style
